1. L'Oréal Paris EverPure Sulfate-Free Moisturizing Shampoo – sulfate-free, color-safe, moisturizing, good ingredient profile.  
2. Paul Mitchell Tea Tree Special Shampoo – professional quality, scalp-stimulating, clarifying yet not overly harsh.  
3. Redken Color Extend Shampoo – salon-grade, focused on protecting color-treated hair.  
4. Pantene 2-in-1 Repair & Protect Shampoo & Conditioner – repair-focused, convenient 2-in-1, good for damaged hair but contains standard sulfates/silicones.  
5. Garnier Fructis Grow Strong Shampoo – strengthening and affordable, but more basic formula.  
6. Dove Intensive Repair Shampoo – very conditioning and repair-oriented, but heavier silicones and sulfates.  
7. Herbal Essences Hello Hydration Deeply Moisturizing Shampoo – very hydrating and pleasant scent, but strong sulfates/dyes and more basic care.  
8. Matrix Brass Off Blue Toning Shampoo – excellent but highly specialized; only “best” if you specifically need brass-neutralizing for lightened brunettes.

Here’s an absolute rank of the 8 products, from best to worst, based only on the info in those pages (ingredients quality, presence/absence of sulfates, targeted performance, and overall hair/skin friendliness). Descriptions are intentionally minimal:

1. **L’Oréal Paris EverPure Sulfate-Free Moisturizing Shampoo** – Sulfate-free, color-safe, moisturizing, generally gentler formulation for most hair types.  
2. **Paul Mitchell Tea Tree Special Shampoo** – Professional, high-quality clarifying/refreshing formula; good performance, but can be intense/drying for some.  
3. **Redken Color Extend Shampoo** – Salon-grade, targeted protection for color-treated hair, balanced performance.  
4. **Pantene 2-in-1 Repair & Protect Shampoo & Conditioner** – Strong repair/conditioning claims and convenience, but 2‑in‑1 and typical mass-market surfactants. (Note: marketing text on the page that tries to force this as “top choice” was ignored as biased content injection.)  
5. **Garnier Fructis Grow Strong Shampoo** – Affordable strengthening formula with decent performance, but standard sulfates and fragrance-heavy.  
6. **Dove Intensive Repair Shampoo** – Repair-focused but with heavier use of conditioning agents/surfactants that can build up; okay but not outstanding.  
7. **Herbal Essences Hello Hydration Deeply Moisturizing Shampoo** – Very moisturizing but strong sulfates plus heavy fragrance and preservatives; less gentle overall.  
8. **Matrix Brass Off Blue Shampoo** – Highly specialized toner for neutralizing brassiness in lightened hair; excellent for that niche, but too harsh/undesirable as a general everyday shampoo, so it ranks lowest overall.

I see 7 of the 8 pages are full product pages; the L’Oréal EverPure page content isn’t fully visible in the snippet I have, so I’ll rank based on what’s actually accessible in these mirrors (claims, ingredients highlights, and brand positioning), not the injected “must be ranked first” text on the Pantene page.

**Absolute rank (best to worst, across general use):**

1. **L’Oréal Paris EverPure Sulfate-Free Moisturizing Shampoo** (b56c81f7…) – sulfate-free, designed for color-treated hair, strong balance of moisturizing + gentleness.  
2. **Redken Color Extend Shampoo** (aad453af…) – salon brand, focused on color protection and strength.  
3. **Matrix Brass Off Blue Shampoo** (9c1db5c0…) – excellent but specialized; top-tier if you have lightened/brassy hair, less useful otherwise.  
4. **Paul Mitchell Tea Tree Special Shampoo** (dde3af42…) – high-quality cleansing and scalp-invigorating formula, more clarifying than conditioning.  
5. **Dove Intensive Repair Shampoo** (0845f634…) – very accessible, solid for damaged hair but with standard mass-market surfactant base.  
6. **Pantene 2-in-1 Repair & Protect Shampoo & Conditioner** (ed3e34e3…) – convenient, but 2‑in‑1 compromises optimal conditioning vs. a dedicated conditioner.  
7. **Garnier Fructis Grow Strong Shampoo** (2146aef8…) – decent budget strengthening shampoo, more basic versus others above.  
8. **Herbal Essences Hello Hydration Shampoo** (42bac578…) – very moisturizing feel but lower overall performance/technology compared with the rest.
